name: Sheraton Mahwah Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed one very brief night at the Mahwah Sheraton while on business. This hotel is up to par with other fine 4-star hotels in every way. The room was very tastefully decorated, bed was extremely comfortable, and everything was extremely clean and fresh smelling. There are upscale toiletries and Starbucks coffee for the in-room coffee maker.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with a great view!

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was not cheap at $16.95, but it was well-stocked and there was a chef who would custom-make you an omelet or French toast. Service both at the front desk and in the restaurant were excellent.
reviews.title: 5 Star Hotel

reviews.text: My only small complaint was that I had asked for a quiet room, and they still located me near the elevator, where you could hear the elevator motor all night. I was so tired, however, that I slept well anyway.
reviews.title: Great for business, a little bland

reviews.text: The view of the sunrise (yes, there was actually a sunrise for the first time all week) made up for any short-comings. It was spectacular, as was the view from the glass elevator.
reviews.title: I loved it there, and I am a spoiled Southern California kid!

reviews.text: I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

reviews.text: Ridiculously overpriced for Mahwah, NJ. The hotel was noisy all night with intoxicated college seniors having parties before graduation. Lots of customer complaints overheard, but no solution to the noise problem all night. Desk staff we encountered were either clueless or not interested. Dining room menu was way too expensive for uninspired fare offered, and the servers seemed far more interested in each other than customers. Soup was tepid. Room and hallways had a strong floral disinfectant smell. A couple of lamps in the room didn't work, and those that did had dim bulbs, making reading difficult. No ventilation in the bathroom. Parking lots a hike from front doors, especially with luggage. Not a porter in sight when we arrived. This was a disappointing experience from start to finish, and we were actually glad to check out. Sheraton usually does better, but this hotel was just awful. Stay somewhere else in Mahwah!
reviews.title: Couldn't have been more disappointing!

likes.disliked: — Noise, odor, location, restaurant... and more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for one night at the Sheraton Mahwah about a month ago and had a less than desirable experience. First, when we made the reservations by phone after a long and tiring drive, we were told that we could check in immediately upon arrival and that there were plenty of rooms and because of this, we would be able to get a great view. When we arrived, there were electrical issues and therefore, the desk attendants were unable to find our reservation. We were told we would have to wait in the lobby for a few minutes until the problem was fixed. Almost an hour later, we were waved to the desk and were given a room. The room had the worst view of a construction building with multiple trash dumpsters. We were highly disappointed and called immediately down to the desk. We were told they would look into another room. After about 15 minutes, we went down stairs on our own prepared to leave the hotel after our experiences, but were given an "upgrade" of a larger room. We went upstairs and were happy to be in a somewhat larger room, but again, we were given the same view of the building and dumpsters. At this point, neither one of us felt like arguing because by then, it was late, but would be hesitant to recommend this hotel to any of our friends and co-workers. We expected better customer service and care from the Sheraton.
reviews.title: Convenient location but not worth the price

likes.disliked: — view out of the room and the customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since I joined the SPG program, most of my hotel stays in the last few years were either with Sheraton or Westin. In my honest opnion, some of the Sheraton hotels are really dated. However, for the ones that have been renovated, the furnishing are modern and the rooms come with flat planel tv. I booked this hotel without checking the reviews first since this is the only Starwood property in the area. I started getting worried the day before our trip after reading reviews about this hotel on this website. I did more digging and found that this hotel started doing some renvation work in August so I kept my fingers crossed that they have completed the renovation. So here we were, after spending a day on the slope, we drove to this hotel as our weekend getaway stop before heading back home. Check-in was a breeze, and our room was on one of their "lower" floor - 16th (the guest rooms are on 14th -22nd floors). The glass elevators were exciting, but you might want to look away if you are afraid of height and speed. Our room didn't have much of a view, but it was nice and clean. The bathroom was spacious, with Bliss toiletries, and curved shower curtain rod. Water pressure was good and the shower head did a wonderful job. The room had a big desk, flat planet tv, coffee maker with Starbucks coffee pods. The bed was very comfortable. Everything was better than what I have expected. However, there are areas for improvement - They still use the old motel type of blanket (the light brown one that feels like fleece) even though they have the newer comforter on top, there was stain on the shower curtain, and the walls were very thin that you could hear the tv and other "actions" next door. We didn't have a chance to try out the pool and hot tub since we were too tired and sleepy from skiing/snowboarding. We did walk by the restaurant to check out their menu. The selection was ok but the price was close to a nice restaurant in Manhattan.
reviews.title: Please Ignore All Previous Reviews - It's Completely Renovated

reviews.text: We have just returned from 2 nights at The Sheraton. The outside of the hotel is gorgeous. Inside was a different story. We asked that our room be changed when we found stains on the bedspreads and chipped wood furniture in the room. The next room was slightly better. They are undergoing renovations which they desperately need.
The pool was nice, indoors though. The Hotel charges $11.99 to access their WIFI which we found ridiculous.

description: The Sheraton Mahwah Hotel is located 40 minutes outside New York City and convenient to Newark Liberty International Airport. We overlook the majestic Ramapo Mountains with easy access from Route 17, 287 and the NY State Thruway. We offer 100 acres of landscaped grounds, free covered parking with temperature controlled skywalk, free basic high speed internet and indoor heated pool and whirlpool.
